snippet.textDisplay: I still remember it like it was yesterday back in the early 2000s I used to go to a Fry's electronics with my mom and would love to explore the game and DVD section they had demo stations with time crisis 3 and dead or alive 3 playing on demo station but I was attracted to Musashi the unique shading and artstyle was so visually appealing to my young eyes while I didn't know much what I was doing and the TV was far I still enjoyed the gameplay and setting I wish I could've bought this game back then
snippet.textOriginal: I still remember it like it was yesterday back in the early 2000s I used to go to a Fry's electronics with my mom and would love to explore the game and DVD section they had demo stations with time crisis 3 and dead or alive 3 playing on demo station but I was attracted to Musashi the unique shading and artstyle was so visually appealing to my young eyes while I didn't know much what I was doing and the TV was far I still enjoyed the gameplay and setting I wish I could've bought this game back then

snippet.textDisplay: As far as I'm concerned, one of the most underappreciated games on the PS2.  I loved this game, Musashi's terrible speaking voice notwithstanding (though it's good for his usual, "Hah!" "Huh!" combat grunts): my main complaint is that it was so short.  But the soundtrack, that's fun anywhere, anytime.  This song is almost pure bliss, and 1:30 to 2:00 always makes me feel like dancing in time to the song.
snippet.textOriginal: As far as I'm concerned, one of the most underappreciated games on the PS2.  I loved this game, Musashi's terrible speaking voice notwithstanding (though it's good for his usual, "Hah!" "Huh!" combat grunts): my main complaint is that it was so short.  But the soundtrack, that's fun anywhere, anytime.  This song is almost pure bliss, and 1:30 to 2:00 always makes me feel like dancing in time to the song.

snippet.textDisplay: @nwilliams8511 Yeah I agree man, it wasnt anything special. But the music was the real deal. I actually beat the whole game, but still I was disappointed in Square, for I expected something more entertaining and lengthy. All in all it wasnt too bad, but wasnt something that I'd miss. :/
snippet.textOriginal: @nwilliams8511 Yeah I agree man, it wasnt anything special. But the music was the real deal. I actually beat the whole game, but still I was disappointed in Square, for I expected something more entertaining and lengthy. All in all it wasnt too bad, but wasnt something that I'd miss. :/
